intro: Rhagadiolus hebelaenus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and prefers well-draining soil. It is popular as a houseplant due to its compact size and ability to bloom year-round under proper care. Rhagadiolus hebelaenus is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
